result.execSummary:
The defendant Zane G. Zimpel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Submit to AODA and follow through with all recommendations.

Mental health assessment as required by agent.

Pay for, attend, and successfully complete any educational/counseling required by agent.  

Defendant is to provide or turn over any ammunition he possesses to law enforcement.  Law enforcement can search the property in the company of the Defendant to search for guns and ammunition.  All guns/ammunition to be forfeited to law enforcement.  Law enforcement may do with them anything they are legally allowed to.

Pay court costs and costs of supervision.

8 days credit in the event of revocation.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zane G. Zimpel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zane G. Zimpel in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel advise the Court that the parties have a plea agreement.  DA Harper details the agreement; states that part of the proposed sentence calls for the def to provide/produce all ammunition on his property to law enforcement at the direction of his probation agent.   Additionally, DA requests that law enforcement be allowed to go to the residence to confirm compliance; all ammunition to be destroyed, sold or used for an educational purpose; same with guns.  Def states he has already worked with law enforcement on this.  

Initial appearance completed.  Court states that def is charged with felon possession of firearms as a repeater.

Prelim waiver conducted.

Def pleads guilty as charged.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.

Atty. M states that def has 8 days credit for the time he's been held since Court's setting of 1k cash bond.

Def addresses Court.

Court orders sentence withheld for probation of 3 years with conditions to include:   AODA/follow through; m.h. assts as required by agent; def to pay for, attend, and succ. complete any educational/counseling required by agent.  Also, Def to provide/turn over any ammunition he possesses to law enforcement.  Law enforcement can search the property in the company of def to search for guns and ammo.  All guns/ammo to be forfeited to law enforcement and they may do with them whatever they are legally able to.  Pay costs.  8 days for time served.

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Zane G. Zimpel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Zane G. Zimpel appeared by video means.  Atty. M asks for June 24th scheduling.  Initial appearance conducted.  Court states charge and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as his rights.  Prelim time limits waived.  Adj. initial set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Def. to submit to booking/printing at RCSD.

Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lisa A McDougal not in court. Defendant Zane G. Zimpel in court via video means from the Richland County Jail where he is in custody following arrest on fta warrant.  Court notes that def also has warrants for ftp fines.  DA asks for bail in the amount of $1000 cash on 15CF3; def will need to be printed as well.  Court orders bond as requested and directs def to contact SPD re appointment.  Court sets initial appr for Wed., June 17 at 1:30 p.m.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
RCSD Dispo of Warrant or Commitment

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Zane G. Zimpel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Zane G. Zimpel not in court.  At 10:12 a.m., DA requests warrant.  Court notes that warrant was stayed until this date at a previous hearing.  With def's continued non-appearance, Court orders the warrant and will sign it when the DA presents it.

Defendant Zane G. Zimpel not in court. Atty McDougal for defense. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA requests warrant be authorized but stayed until next hearing. So ordered.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
